Improvements.Improvement: Extract repeated code to separate methods
Improvements.Description: Repetitive code makes your program longer, harder to read, and more complex. It is better to extract the repetitive code into its own method. This keeps your code DRY (Don't Repeat Yourself), making it easier to maintain, understand, and debug.

Magic strings are literals that are used in the source code, which can make your code harder to understand and maintain. They should be replaced with named constants to increase readability and avoid mistakes from typos or misunderstandings.
